text: Bright, clear gold color with a big frothy head of white foam. A bit of sweet grain, trace of spicy and floral hops, and perhaps a splash of orange citrus.

Appearance: Lightly golden body, a bit of haziness to it. Short-lived, white head.

Smell: Lightly bready, basic pale maltiness encapsulated with pils. Zesty, spicy, lightly lemony accent from the Noble hops.

Taste: Bready, lightly grainy and gently sweet with a skinny ribbon of sulfur. Spicy hops, citrusy with a bit of sassy grassiness to it. Lightly bitter. Drying, lightly grainy, pils-hinted finish.

Mouthfeel: Medium-light body. Medium carbonation.

Overall: Fairly solid lil beer.
355ml bottle. This is a rather poor attempt at a helles, super sweet and unbalanced, not refreshing. Wtf do beer nerds smoke? (edit: i bumped it out of the top 50! Justice!)

Embossed longneck, fair label. Misty, almost clear, golden. Jasmine tea, floral aroma. Mineral, saisonish, a little bretty, low bittering, some soapy, faintly sweet. Lightish body. Thanks to PorterPounder.
Bottle. Lightly hazy golden with white foam. Aroma of grass, citrus peel, flowers and straw. Tastes lightly sweet and citrusy and mildly hopped. Crisp and smooth and light bodied.
Spicy and floral hops a little more present than expected, with a crisp malty backbone with a little sweetness. Finish is abrupt.

Pours a half finger of head on a hazy straw body.
Aroma is lemon zest and grains.
Taste is an interesting low level of fruit sweetness with the mildest of lemon bitter at the end.
Texture is crisp.

12 oz bottle: Aroma has got a nice hop bite to it with a grainy malt texture intermingled. Appearance is a clear golden with a thick white head that lingers for quite a while. Taste has got some sharp hop notes, fading quickly into a dry malt texture. Palate is mild, carbonated, and light. Overall, decent for a hells but nothing to write home about. Cheers!

Bottle. Honey, orange, biscuit malt, and fresh hay aroma. Slightly hazy golden yellow with large white head. Moderately sweet citrus, honey, biscuit malt, and mildly bitter fresh hay flavor. Okay body. Decent but malt flavor too light.

12 oz bottle. Pours deep golden with tall, long lasting, fluffy, white head. Aroma is of bready malt and some pears. Body is medium and slightly crisp. Bready malt and some hops combine on the palate. Finish is long semi-dry. Good Summer brew.
Bottle from Walmart. Slightly sweet and grainy up front. Some nice grassy hop character to it. Pretty clean with a little bit of creaminess to it. Easy drink lighter brew.
UPDATED: JUN 3, 2017 Mild clear straw pour with a thin lacy head. Taste is nice clean and mild. Kind of dry and crisp. A little yeast vibe. So far the winner of the summer sampler.

Bottle as pictured from kroger. Bright and clear looking fer sure. Good co2 is first initial impression. Then, its not as sweet or cloying as many domestic helles, actually a pretty refreshing dort, yep. Not bad or did I just complete a difficult job and Im simply relieved that its over?
user_location: Beaver Valley, Beaver County, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Bottle from Sam Summer Sampler. Pours a clear yellow with a white head. Nose is sweet malt, grain, and some floral character. Flavor is makt, grain, mild fruit, mild floral, and some dryness from the yeast. Not my favorite, but an enjoyable helles nonetheless. Light in body and lingering dryness from the yeast.
Bottle. It poured a clear pale gold color with a big frothy white head. The aroma was malty with floral and light citrus notes. The taste was slightly sweet. It was an enjoyable lager.

12 ounce bottle. Slightly hazy golden, large foamy off-white head, decent retention. Aroma of pale malt, grassy hops and a bit of lemon. The taste is lemon, pale malt, grass. Medium bodied, mild lingering bitterness, well balanced. Nice.
12oz bottle from the Summer Pack - nose is grassy and wild grass. sip adds lemon zest, floral notes and light grapefruit. interesting mix of sweet and bitter with a touch of tart.
12oz bottle-retaining white head with trailing lace-yellow/gold. A-bready-grain. T-some spice hops, sweet grain.

5/20/17. 12oz bottle from a summer mix 12pk from Five Points. Golden pour with a small khaki head. Light grainy aroma, mild spice, hint of sweetness. Lightly sweet malty flavor, hint of spice, grainy pale malts. Not bad.

12 oz bottle from the summer variety pack. Aroma is doughy malts, grassy hops, a berry-like fruitiness. Pours slightly hazy golden with a thick off-white head with excellent retention and decorative lace. Taste is sweet with lots of grassy, grainy flavor. Slightly dry, lightly bitter finish. Perfectly creamy mouthfeel with tight-knit bubbles. Not bad, but I dont think this will ever be one of my favorite styles.
gold color; light malt and floral hop arome; light malt flavor; slight fruit notes with crisp hops

12 oz bottle in a pint glass. Pours a mostly clear dark yellow, looks great. Little malt aroma and a light refreshing taste. Soda bread and brightness. A nice drinking beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Solid helles. Mix pack fodder. Crisp bitter finish on a pale malt body. Had that helles type yeast presence. Not bad.

From the 12 fl. oz. bottle with an expiration date of September 2017. Yellow, bubbly and carbonated pour building up to a long-lasting white foamy head that laces as it fades. Not a whole lot to the aroma. It has some toasted biscuit and bread and maybe a grassy hop presence. The body is light but fairly smooth. The taste has the same toasted sweetness with a kind of rustic, herbal quality that kicks in toward the end. Yeah, I dont think I will drink this that often.
Aroma is light and sweet. Body is clean, light, crisp. Flavor of pale malts and yeast. Decently balanced.

Bottle. Pours golden with a small white head. Aroma is mostly of grain with some spices. Well balanced with some sweetness and also some bitter hop character. Light bodied and easy to drink. Refreshing.

Malty grainy aroma with lemony hop character.
Pours a clear light golden color with creamy white head
Malty grainy flavor with spicy hop character.
Light bodied, medium co2, quick crisp finish
Easy drinking lager. Not much to it, but still enjoyable

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a golden amber from a bottle. Not much of an aroma, somewhat grassy. Flavor is more of a honey and lemongrass with a light grass aftertaste. Good beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Aroma is earthy/grainy malts and fruit/citrus/sugar. The flavor is fruit/citrus, malts, hops and a bitter finish.

Respectable take on a no-frills style, giving up moderate toasted grain and grassy sweetness on top of firm, floral Noble hops. Modest lager esters add a bit of depth, and a salty/bready note in the finish complements the mildly bitter fade. Pour is absolutely beautiful, and the texture feels about right for summer beer. Nose is lacking, but otherwise weve got a perfectly acceptable lager.

Golden Hour has a thick, off-white head, a slightly hazy, bubbly, golden appearance, and heavy blobs of glass lacing. Aroma is bready and zesty, with lemon notes. Taste is of spicy, white bread, yeast, and low-level hop bitterness. Mouthfeel is medium, and Golden Hour finishes crisp and refreshing. RJT

Tallahassee, Fl - Publix Supermarket - Southwood. Pours a sparkling medium golden with a long lasting snow white bubbly head; nice bubble action. Aroma has some fresh lake water accents, a touch of wort and spent grain. Flavor is true to the style with lots of grain, some grassy notes, a touch of nuttiness and just a hint of yeast. Mouthfeel has a pleasant thickness to it, good sturdy very drinkable lager.

Bottle:
Lightly hazed, light golden-yellow with a small white head.
Lemon, grain malt aroma.
Flavour is a hint of lemon-peel, citrus...grain malt.
Simple, but satisfying.....mild grassy bitter.
A pretty solid-to-style offering.
